comment: * Describes the meta data for an installed AppWidget provider. The fields in this class * correspond to the fields in the <appwidget-provider> xml tag.

variables.name: RESIZE_NONE
variables.comment: * Widget is not resizable.

variables.name: RESIZE_HORIZONTAL
variables.comment: * Widget is resizable in the horizontal axis only.

variables.name: RESIZE_VERTICAL
variables.comment: * Widget is resizable in the vertical axis only.

variables.name: RESIZE_BOTH
variables.comment: * Widget is resizable in both the horizontal and vertical axes.

variables.name: WIDGET_CATEGORY_UNKNOWN
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: WIDGET_CATEGORY_HOME_SCREEN
variables.comment: * Indicates that the widget can be displayed on the home screen. This is the default value.

variables.name: WIDGET_CATEGORY_KEYGUARD
variables.comment: * Indicates that the widget can be displayed on the keyguard.

variables.name: WIDGET_CATEGORY_SEARCHBOX
variables.comment: * Indicates that the widget can be displayed within a space reserved for the search box.

variables.name: WIDGET_FEATURE_RECONFIGURABLE
variables.comment:
* The widget can be reconfigured anytime after it is bound by starting the
     * {@link #configure} activity.
     *
     * @see #widgetFeatures

variables.name: WIDGET_FEATURE_HIDE_FROM_PICKER
variables.comment:
* The widget is added directly by the app, and the host may hide this widget when providing
     * the user with the list of available widgets to choose from.
     *
     * @see AppWidgetManager#requestPinAppWidget(ComponentName, Bundle, PendingIntent)
     * @see #widgetFeatures

variables.name: WIDGET_FEATURE_CONFIGURATION_OPTIONAL
variables.comment:
* The widget provides a default configuration. The host may choose not to launch the provided
     * configuration activity.
     *
     * @see #widgetFeatures

variables.name: provider
variables.comment:
* Identity of this AppWidget component. This component should be a {@link * android.content.BroadcastReceiver}, and it will be sent the AppWidget intents * {@link android.appwidget as described in the AppWidget package documentation}. * *

This field corresponds to the android:name attribute in * the <receiver> element in the AndroidManifest.xml file.

variables.name: minWidth
variables.comment:
* The default width of the widget when added to a host, in px. The widget will get * at least this width, and will often be given more, depending on the host. * *

This field corresponds to the android:minWidth attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: minHeight
variables.comment:
* The default height of the widget when added to a host, in px. The widget will get * at least this height, and will often be given more, depending on the host. * *

This field corresponds to the android:minHeight attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: minResizeWidth
variables.comment:
* Minimum width (in px) which the widget can be resized to. This field has no effect if it * is greater than minWidth or if horizontal resizing isn't enabled (see {@link #resizeMode}). * *

This field corresponds to the android:minResizeWidth attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: minResizeHeight
variables.comment:
* Minimum height (in px) which the widget can be resized to. This field has no effect if it * is greater than minHeight or if vertical resizing isn't enabled (see {@link #resizeMode}). * *

This field corresponds to the android:minResizeHeight attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: maxResizeWidth
variables.comment:
* Maximum width (in px) which the widget can be resized to. This field has no effect if it is * smaller than minWidth or if horizontal resizing isn't enabled (see {@link #resizeMode}). * *

This field corresponds to the android:maxResizeWidth attribute in the * AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: maxResizeHeight
variables.comment:
* Maximum height (in px) which the widget can be resized to. This field has no effect if it is * smaller than minHeight or if vertical resizing isn't enabled (see {@link #resizeMode}). * *

This field corresponds to the android:maxResizeHeight attribute in the * AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: targetCellWidth
variables.comment:
* The default width of a widget when added to a host, in units of launcher grid cells. * *

This field corresponds to the android:targetCellWidth attribute in the * AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: targetCellHeight
variables.comment:
* The default height of a widget when added to a host, in units of launcher grid cells. * *

This field corresponds to the android:targetCellHeight attribute in the * AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: updatePeriodMillis
variables.comment:
* How often, in milliseconds, that this AppWidget wants to be updated. * The AppWidget manager may place a limit on how often a AppWidget is updated. * *

This field corresponds to the android:updatePeriodMillis attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file. * *

Note: Updates requested with updatePeriodMillis * will not be delivered more than once every 30 minutes.

variables.name: initialLayout
variables.comment:
* The resource id of the initial layout for this AppWidget. This should be * displayed until the RemoteViews for the AppWidget is available. * *

This field corresponds to the android:initialLayout attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: initialKeyguardLayout
variables.comment:
* The resource id of the initial layout for this AppWidget when it is displayed on keyguard. * This parameter only needs to be provided if the widget can be displayed on the keyguard, * see {@link #widgetCategory}. * *

This field corresponds to the android:initialKeyguardLayout attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: configure
variables.comment:
* The activity to launch that will configure the AppWidget. * *

This class name of field corresponds to the android:configure attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file. The package name always corresponds to the package containing * the AppWidget provider.

variables.name: label
variables.comment:
* The label to display to the user in the AppWidget picker.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #loadLabel(android.content.pm.PackageManager)}.

variables.name: icon
variables.comment:
* The icon to display for this AppWidget in the AppWidget picker. If not supplied in the * xml, the application icon will be used. * *

This field corresponds to the android:icon attribute in * the <receiver> element in the AndroidManifest.xml file.

variables.name: autoAdvanceViewId
variables.comment:
* The view id of the AppWidget subview which should be auto-advanced by the widget's host. * *

This field corresponds to the android:autoAdvanceViewId attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: previewImage
variables.comment:
* A preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured. * If not supplied, the AppWidget's icon will be used. * *

This field corresponds to the android:previewImage attribute in the AppWidget * meta-data file.

variables.name: previewLayout
variables.comment:
* The layout resource id of a preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's * configured. * *

Unlike previewImage, previewLayout can better showcase AppWidget in different locales, * system themes, display sizes & density etc. * *

If supplied, this will take precedence over the previewImage on supported widget hosts. * Otherwise, previewImage will be used. * *

This field corresponds to the android:previewLayout attribute in the * AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: resizeMode
variables.comment:
* The rules by which a widget can be resized. See {@link #RESIZE_NONE}, * {@link #RESIZE_NONE}, {@link #RESIZE_HORIZONTAL}, * {@link #RESIZE_VERTICAL}, {@link #RESIZE_BOTH}. * *

This field corresponds to the android:resizeMode attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: widgetCategory
variables.comment:
* Determines whether this widget can be displayed on the home screen, the keyguard, or both. * A widget which is displayed on both needs to ensure that it follows the design guidelines * for both widget classes. This can be achieved by querying the AppWidget options in its * widget provider's update method. * *

This field corresponds to the widgetCategory attribute in * the AppWidget meta-data file.

variables.name: descriptionRes
variables.comment:
* Resource id for the description of the AppWidget. * *

This field corresponds to the android:description attribute in the AppWidget * meta-data file.

variables.name: widgetFeatures
variables.comment:
* Flags indicating various features supported by the widget. These are hints to the widget
     * host, and do not actually change the behavior of the widget.
     *
     * @see #WIDGET_FEATURE_RECONFIGURABLE
     * @see #WIDGET_FEATURE_HIDE_FROM_PICKER
     * @see #WIDGET_FEATURE_CONFIGURATION_OPTIONAL

variables.name: providerInfo
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: isExtendedFromAppWidgetProvider
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: generatedPreviewCategories
variables.comment:
* Flags indicating the widget categories for which generated previews are available.
     * These correspond to the previews set by this provider with
     * {@link AppWidgetManager#setWidgetPreview}.
     *
     * @see #WIDGET_CATEGORY_HOME_SCREEN
     * @see #WIDGET_CATEGORY_KEYGUARD
     * @see #WIDGET_CATEGORY_SEARCHBOX
     * @see AppWidgetManager#getWidgetPreview

variables.name: CREATOR
variables.comment: * Parcelable.Creator that instantiates AppWidgetProviderInfo objects

methods.name: public final String loadLabel(PackageManager packageManager)
methods.comment:
* Loads the localized label to display to the user in the AppWidget picker.
     *
     * @param packageManager Package manager instance for loading resources.
     * @return The label for the current locale.

methods.name: public final Drawable loadIcon(@NonNull Context context, int density)
methods.comment:
* Loads the icon to display for this AppWidget in the AppWidget picker. If not * supplied in the xml, the application icon will be used. A client can optionally * provide a desired density such as {@link android.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_LOW} * {@link android.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_MEDIUM}, etc. If no density is * provided, the density of the current display will be used. *

* The loaded icon corresponds to the android:icon attribute in * the <receiver> element in the AndroidManifest.xml file. *

* * @param context Context for accessing resources. * @param density The optional desired density as per * {@link android.util.DisplayMetrics#densityDpi}. * @return The provider icon.

methods.name: public final Drawable loadPreviewImage(@NonNull Context context, int density)
methods.comment:
* Loads a preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured. * A client can optionally provide a desired density such as * {@link android.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_LOW} * {@link android.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_MEDIUM}, etc. If no density is * provided, the density of the current display will be used. *

* The loaded image corresponds to the android:previewImage attribute * in the <receiver> element in the AndroidManifest.xml file. *

* * @param context Context for accessing resources. * @param density The optional desired density as per * {@link android.util.DisplayMetrics#densityDpi}. * @return The widget preview image or null if preview image is not available.

methods.name: public final CharSequence loadDescription(@NonNull Context context)
methods.comment:
* Loads localized description for the app widget. * *

Description is intended to be displayed in the UI of the widget picker. * * @param context Context for accessing resources. * * @return CharSequence for app widget description for the current locale.

methods.name: public final UserHandle getProfile()
methods.comment:
* Gets the user profile in which the provider resides.
     *
     * @return The hosting user profile.

methods.name: public ActivityInfo getActivityInfo()
methods.comment: * Returns the broadcast receiver that is providing this widget.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel out, int flags)
private Drawable loadDrawable(Context context, int density, int resourceId, boolean loadDefaultIcon)

methodNames: public final Drawable loadIcon(@NonNull Context context, int density)
public final Drawable loadPreviewImage(@NonNull Context context, int density)
public final CharSequence loadDescription(@NonNull Context context)
public void writeToParcel(Parcel out, int flags)
private Drawable loadDrawable(Context context, int density, int resourceId, boolean loadDefaultIcon)
